review: Cool little box. Working very well after several weeks now. I was skeptical about streaming video, but this device does it without buffering or loss of HD quality. We are using it wirelessly with no issues. Intuitive interface. If you need a dummies guide, you really are a dummy. Voice command is cool, but hardly ever needed. Great content with Amazon Prime. Just wish they'd put Pushing Daisies back up. We got Netflix too. It shuts itself off when not in use in case you were searching for the power button. Oh, and the screensaver pics are glorious! Amazon wins the streaming box category award! Did I mention we are saving about 100 bucks a month now? Cut the Cable today.

review: I agree with the previously posted comments regarding the difficulty in searching for free content. The reason we pay for the Prime membership, is for the Prime movies/shows--if we have to click on a selection before knowing if it is free or if we have to pay, it becomes frustrating very quickly. I only use the Fire for Netflix watching now, and will likely cancel my Prime membership unless this oversight is fixed.

review: It was simple to set up and get running, took maybe 5 minutes (and most of that was just spent opening up the packaging).  It's quick and responsive, the voice search feature is handy, and it has all of the streaming services I'd ever want (Amazon, Netflix, Hulu+, Pandora, Youtube) and best of all it was extremely cheap.  My wife and I are extremely happy with it and glad to finally cancel our Xbox Live sub (neither of us play games on the Xbox any longer and the only reason we kept it around was for watching shows)
